Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In conclusion , MT induction halts BCNU - induced hippocampal toxicity as it prevented GR inhibition and GSH depletion and counteracted the increased levels of TNFalpha , MDA and caspase - 3 activity with subsequent preservation of cognition .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| BCNU-induced hippocampal toxicity |
| GR inhibition |
| GSH depletion |
| Increased levels of TNFalpha |
| Increased levels of MDA |
| Increased activity of caspase-3 |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| BCNU-induced hippocampal toxicity |
| GSH depletion |
| Increased levels of TNFalpha |
| Increased levels of MDA |
| Increased activity of caspase-3 |

Note: BCNU is an anticancer drug, but it is mentioned as causing a toxicity (hippocampal toxicity) in this context, so it is included as a disease entity. GR refers to the glucocorticoid receptor, but inhibition of GR can lead to various diseases, including neurodegenerative disorders, so it is also included as a disease entity.
